Utterance: Hi again! It's great to see you back. How have you been since our last session?
Hi Ellie! I've been doing well, thanks. Just keeping busy with work and hanging out with friends.
That’s good to hear! Last time, you mentioned enjoying your travels and the experiences they bring. Have you traveled anywhere recently?
Actually, yes! I just got back from a short trip to San Francisco for a weekend getaway. It was nice to explore a new city.
That sounds exciting! What did you enjoy most about San Francisco?
I really loved the food scene there. I tried some amazing seafood and the views from the Golden Gate Bridge were breathtaking.
It sounds like a refreshing experience. How did you feel during the trip? Any moments that stood out to you?
I felt really happy and relaxed. It was nice to take a break from my routine. I even took some time to just sit by the water and reflect.
Reflection can be a powerful tool. What were some of the thoughts or feelings that came up during that time?
I found myself thinking about my career and where I want to be in the next few years. I guess I’m feeling a bit uncertain about my future.
That’s an important topic to explore. What specific uncertainties are you facing regarding your career?
Well, I love my job in IT, but I sometimes wonder if I should pursue something more creative, like working in tech design or development.
It’s great that you’re considering different paths. What attracts you to the idea of a more creative role?
I’ve always enjoyed being creative, whether it's through photography or video games. I think it would be fulfilling to combine that with my technical skills.
That sounds like a wonderful blend of your interests. Have you thought about how you might transition into a more creative role?
I’ve considered taking some design courses or even working on personal projects to build my portfolio. But I’m a bit hesitant to take that leap.
It’s understandable to feel hesitant when contemplating a big change. What do you think is holding you back from pursuing those courses or projects?
I guess it’s the fear of failing or not being good enough. I worry about investing time and not seeing results.
Fear of failure is a common concern. How do you typically cope with those feelings when they arise?
I usually try to distract myself by keeping busy with work or hanging out with friends. But I know that doesn't really solve the underlying issue.
It sounds like you're aware of the distractions, which is a good first step. Would you be open to exploring some strategies to manage that fear of failure?
Yeah, I’d be open to that.
One approach could be reframing your thoughts around failure. Instead of seeing it as a negative outcome, consider it a learning opportunity. How does that resonate with you?
I like that idea. I guess I’ve always seen failure as something to avoid, but it does make sense that it can be a part of growth.
Absolutely! Another strategy could be setting small, achievable goals related to your creative interests. This way, you can build confidence gradually. What do you think about that?
That sounds manageable. I could start with a small photography project or a design challenge.
Great! Setting those smaller goals can help you feel accomplished and reduce the pressure. Would you like to set a specific goal for our next session?
Sure! I think I’ll aim to complete a photography project by next time. Maybe something themed around my recent trip?
That sounds like a fantastic idea! I’m excited to hear about it. How do you feel about committing to this goal?
I feel motivated! It’ll give me something to work on and look forward to.
Wonderful! Before we wrap up, is there anything else on your mind today that you’d like to discuss?
No, I think we covered a lot. I’m looking forward to working on my project!
I’m glad to hear that! I look forward to hearing all about it in our next session. Take care and enjoy the process!
Thanks, Ellie! See you next time.
